title: EastEnders fans in tears over Bex Fowler's harrowing suicide bid
text:

EastEnders viewers were in tears last night as Bex Fowler tried to take her own life in harrowing scenes last night.

Over the last few weeks, fans have watched with unease as Bex has fallen into a deep depression, struggling to deal with the pressure of getting into university.

Despite obtaining a place at Oxford University, Bex continued to feel the pressure of meeting expectations and leaving Walford.

In utterly devastating scenes, Bex left her party in full swing to head back to her bedroom and take pills while she was all alone.

But a drastic change to a normal episode of EastEnders saw a flash-forward to the morning after and a traumatic twist.

(Image: BBC)

Lisa Fowler, who has desperately tried to offer Bex help the night before, told Louise to check how her friend was doing.

Bex's phone was seen ringing on the floor as Sonia walked into Bex's room and discovered her lifeless body.

Horrified Sonia frantically tried to wake her daughter but she was unresponsive and her arm slumped over the side of the bed.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Viewers were left in tears over the traumatic episode, with many saying that they could relate to Bex's struggle.

One tweeted: "F*** me #eastenders has me in bits a lot atm what with the ruby, tiff and bex storylines :( it’s important to spread awareness but it’s so real for some people, so triggering."

While another commented: "I just watched #EastEnders and Bex's suicide scenes were so powerful I almost cried. I could feel it in the pit of my stomach. Watching the lead up, her actually taking the pills and the next morning all in one episode was pretty heavy but it was very well done."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

A third wrote: "Eastenders hitting hard with bex suicide. It was so powerful and I felt it hard as it's my worst fear as my daughter has moved miles away with uni and the thought of her not speaking to me about how she really feels scared me #eastenders #MentalHealthAwareness #speakup."

"#EastEnders Great job on the depression storyline for Bex. People (even the ones that are the closest to you) may never see what is really going on within you. #6000Episode," another wrote.

One commented: "I was Bex once... Top marks with this storyline... got it bang on. People don't notice. It takes years to heal but there is happiness to be found again... you just gotta hang in there. ❤ #EastEnders."

*EastEnders airs Mondays and Fridays at 8pm and Tuesdays and Thursdays at 7.30pm on BBC One

If you're struggling and need to talk, the Samaritans operate a free helpline open every hour of the day on 116 123. Alternatively, you can email jo@samaritans.org or visit the website to find your local branch
